Reviews.Title: “Central, modern, friendly, free wifi in rooms. Really happy with this place.”
Reviews.Author: SoloRachAusUK
Reviews.Content: Based just off Gran Via in a colourful neighbourhood this hostel is streets ahead of others I have stayed in for the same price. Modern rooms, in room free wifi, air con, so central and all for a competitive price. I will stay here again on my return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and nice welcome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: You won't find better for the price and it is so central. Alos the room was surprisingly quiet as the street has little traffic and it gave onto a courtyard

Reviews.Title: “Precious Gem in the heart of Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: BINOYKRISHNAN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hostal Ballesta for one night some time in July "Excellent stay for the price that you give". It is very close to Garen Via tube metro station, and there are few good restaurants too very close by the hotel, that to pure Spanish restaurants. Hotel is located in a usual small street ( real Spanish way), you might be a bit surprised when very first time you enter into the street, coz' lot of ladies are waiting to welcome you and at your service. Just relax it is just a "Hi - How are you" chat, and they are not gonna disturb you. With all those sweet 'n warm welcome in the street, what is next? you think about a Spanish receptionist struggling to welcome you!!!!.. My friend then you are wrong, you will be welcomed with a great and more sweet smile that you already received from the street :) and the best part is they are very good with their english, and explain you each and every thing that you need. No what about the rooms? one the best that i have seen for this price. very clean, well maintained, personal locker, bathrooms are really spacious good shower, clean bath towels. you have small balcony opening to the street, enough to keep just 2 chairs. 2 layers of curtains to have flexibility of privacy and light as much as you want. Good wifi connection too. Even the pathways are really well decorated, and clean. It is really a good service for the money that you are paying for a hostal facility. you can't expect more privacy with respect to the noise in the next room or corridor. Excellent customer service, why this specific statement is we went out to have lunch just after check-in before going out we asked receptionist for some information, she said she will help me regarding with that once am back ( because we were starving ), and when we were back there was a change in the shift and another person was there in the reception, the best part is first receptionist had clearly given instruction/ information to the new person about it, and there was no need me explaining her what was the issue. I will stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find!”
Reviews.Author: Nate B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed just one night at Hostal Ballesta in June and it was much more like a hotel than a hostal. The location could not be any better - within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in Madrid. It was very nicely decorated inside and our room was very clean and comfortable. We were so impressed with how low the cost was for such a quality hotel! The woman at the desk spoke English and gave us great restaurant recommendations. We would stay at this place again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viv3krb
Reviews.Content: This is definitely more of a hotel than a hostal. It's located within 5 mins walk to the Gran Via metro station and is located within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Room was a good size with double beds, a small TV, table, safe and cupboards. The windows faced a wall but that didn't bother us as we were hardly there during the day. The staff at the hostal are friendly and helped us with some directions when we needed it. The Wifi was good enough for our usage and they provided free printers, if we needed to print anything. The ensuite was perfect with an excellent shower. The rooms were cleaned on a daily basis as well. The location is a bit sketchy as you will see a few women hanging around the area - but they never bothered us nor did we feel unsafe at any point in the trip. Will definitely stay again at this location. This hostal is a steal at the prices given the good quality of the rooms and the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dani-Elizabeth86
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we needed it to be. Clean, friendly staff (who do speak English, but were also helpful to us as we are learning Spanish and insisted on attempting to communicate wit them in their language!), well located and surprisingly cheap! When you book a cheap hotel there is always the fear that it will be awful, but this was anything but. The room was small, and the view was, well, of a wall. But you don't come to Madrid to sit in your room. The air conditioning works, the showers are nice, the bed is comfy. Comes with free use of a safe. Rooms are cleaned and linen changed every day. We got the metro from the airport to the hotel with no bother whatsoever. It is less than a three minute walk from Gran Via metro station. If you plan what changes you need to make on the metro and have a little look at google street view so you know where to turn off Gran Via you are golden (next to H&M works well!). No need to pay the 35 Euro for a taxi. A hotel shuttle also calls at Ballesta for the return trip to the airport, but we would have to have got up really early to get it, so didn't bother! Oh and there is a restaurant next door that does arugeably the best Hamburgessa in Madrid. I can't say enough nice things about this place, it is simply where we WILL stay the next time we go to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lamb003
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, great location, great room, great customer service. The room was cleaned everyday and the staff were really friendly. Our room was plenty big enough for 2 with a lovely ensuite. Unfortunatley we only got a view of the wall but atleast it was quiet and kept the sun out. I would definately recommend staying here to couples on a budget but who still want quality. Don't let the title 'hostal' put you off as it is definatly more like a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: * Excelent Service * Near to the most popular places like: Puerta Del Sol and Plaza Mayor * Wi-Fi conection is really fast

Reviews.Title: “Cool!”
Reviews.Author: Neptune986
Reviews.Content: I had good time in Madrid and l spent a great holiday into. Hotel is clean, tidy really close to Gran Via. I'll be back for sure. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sharone m
Reviews.Content: Ballesta is a good budget hotel, perfectly situated in the heart of Madrid. Room was spotless clean, quiet, with a room which actually was quite large for an affordable place in a capital. Staff is friendly, helpful and English speaking. We recommend the place taking in consideration that it is not a 5 stars palace, but a good modern best value place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hostal”
Reviews.Author: suyumna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hostal during two nights in December. The value for money is great. Perfect location in Madrid, very near to Sol and La Gran Via. Staff: very Nice and helpful. Rooms: Very clean and good size. I liked everything from this place. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: ATLtoEUR767
Reviews.Content: STAY HERE! I found this hotel/hostal on booking.com for only 45 Euros a night and I wasn't expecting much but a bed and a shower. However, after arriving to the hotel we got far more than we paid for. Helpful English speaking staff, trendy decor, super clean facility, spacious rooms, reliable and free wi-fi, and a room with a balcony. Some of the reviews commented on the "ladies of the night" and yes they are working the street outside the hotel but they never bothered us as we entered or left the hotel. Other reviews talked about the walls being thin and I found this to be true as well but my room was on the back of the building so it was a lot less noisy. I was very comfortable in and outside of the hotel. The hotel is in a great location and easy to walk to everything Madrid has to offer, we never stepped foot in a cab. This hostal also allows guest which was nice being we had friends staying at another hotel who dropped by our room for a meeting place or to take a free drink in the room. Other hostals in Madrid charge for visitors to come to your room so please be aware when booking. My overall assessment is the hotel in UNDERPRICED and you get more than what you pay for. I will stay here again and I definitely recommend it to other travelers to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ewa_Z
Reviews.Content: Loved it, loved it, loved it! This place has NO downside: it's right off Gran Via, so you cannot be more in the center. It's 2 minutes walk from Gran Via metro station. The place is renovated, it looks nice, has a nice hang out area and it is also squeaky clean. Staff is super-friendly and well-informed, and there's free access to internet and wi-fi. It is the more "flamboyant" side of Gran Via, so indeed there are some ladies at the door, but they cannot be bothered by Ballesta guests, and vice versa:). Whaterever you are looking for in Madrid it's walking distance: major tourist sites 10-15 minutes, tons of shops: 2 minutes, and the bars at night: 5-10 minutes. And still it is quiet!!!! It is the best value for money during the week, during the weekends you pay re a bit more but still a great deal for what it offers. Mercedes, special thank yous for your patience with our 3 visits in 8 days!:)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: pero305
Reviews.Content: If it had a hair dryer, in Paris they would rank it as a 3 star hotel and charge double:) Location is absolutely fantastic - a minute walk from Gran Via. In 4 days I didn´t have the need to use public transport. Rooms are of decent size, cleaned on daily basis. Free wi-fi in the rooms. Staff is very friendly. It´s a great no frills place, highly recommended for travelers on the budget. And do not worry about the ladies of the night (and the daytime too, as they seem to operate 24 hour service lol) in its back street; the area is perfectly safe and they add a special flair to the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bluealex
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of the city, ideal for young couples or group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “hostel ballesta”
Reviews.Author: marshall h
Reviews.Content: i'd rather stay on a park bench than suffer this dive again,walls of paper cleanliness a new concept and bed linen that the local working girls would scoff at.saying that they are handy for directions but take care by the irish bar in concepion avenue,(hope that's spelt right),there's a metro station there where lots of homeless boys live and they will find a way of parting you from your $$$$.be under no illusions they have nothing so have nothing to lose.i met a guy from chile who'd lost his passport and was having problems and he wised me up to this fact,for which i gave him some clothes bought him food and a few beers.gran via is a lively place with lots of fun to be had just keep your wits about you and do not get to drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Good but too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Shake84
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for the price. Walking distance to the shopping area, helpful staff, and decent rooms. Like other reviewers mentioned though, the noise was way too much. Not only was there loud construction going on in the early morning, but I could hear people walking past our room at all hours. The door and walls are so thin that sometimes it sounded like they were in the room with us! If this problem is resolved, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: keo98
Reviews.Content: Although the Ballesta is located near adult entertainment and working girls, do not let this put you off because it had no impact on our stay. The hostal is very clean, with comfortable rooms that have aircon, free WiFi and a great showeri. No coffee making facilities but a vending machine is available downstairs. Very friendly and helpful staff. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Definetly hotel with 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: gnjurac
Reviews.Content: The hostal is great. Very good and clean rooms. Room is cleaned every day with new towels every day. Bed is OK. The only problem is pretty bad noise isolation, especially doors. So in the morning I was awaken pretty early. No chance of longer sleep. There are also prostitutes on the street whole day, but you get used to them and there is no safety problems. Location is excellent, near Gran via, 10 minutes to Plaza del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: Bathor
Reviews.Content: + New, centrally located; free internet connection and printing, very reasonably priced. - While the sheets and the bathroom fittings were clean, the cleanliness of the floor left a lot to be desired: it had been vacuumed very hastily, if at all, and definitely not washed. Some girl at the reception could do with an intensive course in good manners, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Rainbow222
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and had no problems. Great location close to all the main sites within easy walking distance.staff friendly and helpful.rooms are nothing fancy but clean and comfortable.Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with almost perfect location and better than expected service”
Reviews.Author: EstebanBR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ballesta (means crossbow in Spanish) for 8 nights at the end of May. It is on the cusp between Malasana and Chueca neighborhoods. We asked to stay in the back of the hotel so it was completely quiet at night. The room and shower were smallish but comfortable. Pluses were the free good wireless connection in rooms for smart phones, locking inroom safe, inexpensive coffee machine downstairs, internet and printer access in office, early checkin and cheap international calls. We had to make two international calls and the total for about 5 minutes was 1 euro! I made one call from a payphone that cost me $50 USD. ATM and metro (Gran Via) within 5 minutes. The ladies of the night outside never bothered us and unless you have small children I don't see anything wrong with staying at this hotel if you have some budget limits but don't want to spend too much time commuting to the sights. Everything except maybe the Prado is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern let down by an extremely uncomfortable bed.”
Reviews.Author: BandMandM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hostal Ballista for one night. The Hostal is in a really central location just off the Gran Via and a few minutes walk from the metro. The area around the hotel is a little "colourful" with lots of prostitutes hanging around in the street at all hours of the day and night. They never bothered me however and I didn't feel uncomfortable or unsafe in this neighbourhood. The hostal itself is very welcoming and the lady who checked me in was extremely friendly. The lounge area is funky and had a relaxing feel and the internet room was an added bonus as was the free wifi access. The hostal has a lift which made the trek to the fourth floor easy. My room was small but nicely decorated and very clean. It contained all the standard essentials you need plus the added bonus of a free to use safe. The bathroom was really clean and the shower very powerful which is a bonus. There was a small balcony which wasn't very private at all and the view was horrible but this wasn't the deal breaker. What really let down hostal Ballesta for me was the bed. On first impressions I was impressed by the size of the bed, it was more of a three-quarter double than a single. There was only one pillow provided which was wafer thin so on returning to the hostal after dinner I asked the guy on reception for another pillow. He seemed a little annoyed at being disturbued and went off to find me another pillow. I was really tired after such a long day and was looking forward to a comfortable sleep. I didn't get one. The matress was exceptionally hard and the springs were poking into me whenever I moved. I can honestly say without exception it was the most uncomfortable bed I've ever attempted to sleep in. For me the whole reason detre of a hotel is to provide a good night sleep. Unfortunately I didn't get one. The rock-hard bed was made even more uncomfortable by the plastic matress protector which made me sweat like mad all night. These plastic protectors are a real pet hate of mine. Having gone to bed just after 11:30pm I was still awake at 5am! Not a good nights sleep at all. The hostal was also quite noisy with other guests slamming doors and the walls between the rooms are so thin you can hear everything that your neighbour is doing. On check out I wasn't asked if everything was ok with my stay. The guy was quite brusque with me. The hostal could be brilliant if they sort out their beds and improve their soundproofing. However as it stands I was dissapointed by Hostal Ballesta it had so much potential but it did not deliver for me. On a final positive note the hostal does have a left luggage room which was handy for me as I had a late flight.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean friendly service great location it exceeded our expectation. Other than free wifi they also have computers and printers for guests. The only issue that's probably common for most places is if the guests next door are a bit noisy you can hear it all. It's close to Gran Via - a side street behind it with lots of great eating places around. The airbus stop is close by just a short bus ride away. We did not bother to take metro. Great value and services!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, secure, comfortable. Was impressed with free in room safe and free wifi - have had to pay for both in the past so pleasant that these were there to use for free. Good location too only a few moments from metro at Gran Via so easy to get to when arriving from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Well located but a little bit noisy...”
Reviews.Author: 79Helo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to gran via, but in a noisy area to sleep at night. But it was ok. The rooms were clean and modern. The relation between the price x benefit is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: vasj
Reviews.Content: We've been lucky to stay in Ballesta for a couple of nights last August. Though the weather was hot it was always cool and nice in our room. The room itself was spacious and nice-decorated. Huge number of TV-channels (both Spanish and international) was a pleasant addition =) Chambermaids did excelent job and the reception guys was polite, though some of them did not speak english (which was OK for me as I speas Spanish a bit). There is a free wi-fi connection and you can use computers in lobby also absolutely for free! The location is really great! You can walk all around city center and you're still not far from the hotel! Metro-station and city-tour bus stop were in 2 minuets walk! I would definatly would like to returne some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a hostel price”
Reviews.Author: aybak
Reviews.Content: This is not a hostal, it's a hotel. Perfect location, clean rooms, I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “NOISY, THINK TWICE ABOUT STAYING AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: gb2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight. It is in a great location. However, the person at the front desk was watching TV with the full volume up the entire night & disregarded our request to lower the volume. We did not sleep one minute and felt very unsafe. There are no elevators and lots of stairs. I suggest you think twice before staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great short stay, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: PnMW
Reviews.Content: All staff were helpful and friendly, 24 hr reception a definite bonus. Room modern and clean, but small. Free wifi was great. The hostal is close to the Gran Via and we able to walk to all main attractions. Excellent value with local colour for free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet hotel, never mind the hookers”
Reviews.Author: gerry_marilyn
Reviews.Content: We had trouble finding Calle Ballesta because the street name doesn't reach Gran Via, but once we found the hotel it was clean and quiet. There were hookers around, but they never bothered us. There are supermarkets and restuarants close by. It's convenient to Plaza del Sol and metro lines. They have free internet in the rooms, as well as computers, printers and big screen TV in the common area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Christie85
Reviews.Content: Hostal Ballesta has a great location just off Gran Via, The rooms have everything you could need for a short break, they're small but cosy. The hotel reception/tv lounge is great especially in the winter, we often sat by the fire to warm up. I have noticed on some reviews people have complained about the prostitutes on the road leading to the hotel, unfortunately like most cities Madrid also has a red light district and if you want a central location this is one of the things you have to put up with. Overall the staff were amazing and the hotel was clean. I would definitely stay here next time I visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: bedan
Reviews.Content: New room very good bed. the rooms are very smal for single traveller ok fast checking, everthing was ready nice staff 40 min from the airport by metro, metrostation about 5 min walking distance cost € 2

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price! Perfect for a 1st time in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: NewyorkNewyork2307
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights for our 1st time in Madrid and its GREAT value for the price: rooms are extremely clean, bathroom is modern, I definitly recommend it! there´s a TV and a fan in the room. There are 3 PCs available with free internet and free printers. The location is great, right in the heart of the city (you can do everything walking). Only drawbacks: - Hookers in the street (though the street is not dangerous or shady at all, don´t worry, but it can be surprising at first!) - It was very hot in our room

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: crosslover
Reviews.Content: hotel location is good...except is popular area for ladies of the night...the room was very small...the shower was very small....no breakfast....only 2 staff people spoke english...stayed there 8 nights so got to meet several of them...they did have free internet...saving grace..otherwise would look for another hotel next time in madrid...

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: Silverino
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Hostal Ballesta on February 2009. Its location is superb, just few meters from the Gran Via, close to several subway stations. The room was very large, had a double bed with desk, drawer and large LCD TV with satellite channels. The toilet was very clean and had a shower too. Breakfast is not available, but there are several shops nearby. There are some vending machines in the hall. The hotel is located in a road with few prostitutes around, but the hotel itself is OK and it's safe to walk around even at night.
